title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 July 2014 - XWiki
content:

11:43 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <lucaa> has quit  
12:51 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
13:08 <msmeria1> vmassol: hello  
13:09 <msmeria1> can you grant me PR on the test wiki ?  
13:10 <msmeria1> I imported a XAR as an Admin and it seems the livetable doesn't work anymore because I didn't save some pages with PR  
13:41 <vmassol> msmeria1: hi, I cannot do that, it's not possible but I can give you PR on the whole farm  
13:41 <vmassol> so either that or you tell me which page to save  
13:41 <vmassol> you decide  
13:42 <msmeria1> vmassol: thanks, but Sorin already helped me  
13:42 <vmassol> ok  
13:42 <msmeria1> he saved the pages with PR and the livetable works now  
13:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: is there a way to see all translations for a given language on l10n?  
13:57 <msmeria1> vmassol: on second thought I could use PR  
13:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: just find them ? or having an editor view for all translation resource at the same time instead of one translation resource ?  
13:58 <msmeria1> seems like I still need it to apply the fix on the test wiki  
13:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: I wanted to see if we have any greek translations  
13:58 <vmassol> (we had an issue to create the greek language but I wanted to check if we bundled any greek translations)  
13:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: all supported languages are listed on the right  
13:59 <vmassol> I don't want to know if it's supported  
14:02 <vmassol> (btw "el" is missing on http://www.wikimatrix.org/edit/XWiki )  
14:03 <tmortagne> you can use l10n search page I guess with el as Language but you can't really filter empty translations  
14:03 <tmortagne> on github I can't find any \*\_el.properties  
14:03 <tmortagne> same for \_el.xml  
14:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: the search works on all apps?  
14:04 <tmortagne> .el.xml sorry  
14:04 <tmortagne> so I guess we don't have any translation  
14:04 <vmassol> AFAICS the UI doesn't allow searching for all apps  
14:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: just don't select any app  
14:04 <tmortagne> I mean don't put any app  
14:04 <vmassol> ah maybe I need to remove  
14:04 <vmassol> yup  
14:04 <vmassol> indeed it's not very useufl for me  
14:04 <tmortagne> but anyway we don't have any greek tx on git  
14:05 <tmortagne> so I guess you have the answer to your question  
14:05 <vmassol> you searched everywhere? for all apps?  
14:05 <vmassol> \*\_el\* is probably enough indeed  
14:05 <tmortagne> I searched in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform  
14:05 <vmassol> as it should cover both ApplicationResources and xml  
14:05 <vmassol> that's just platform  
14:05 <vmassol> there's XE too  
14:05 <tmortagne> there is not much in XE  
14:06 <vmassol> ahah we have greek for stopwords :)  
14:06 <vmassol> (for SOLR)  
14:06 <tmortagne> that's not related to l&0n wiki  
14:06 <tmortagne> \*l10n  
14:06 <vmassol> I know  
14:07 <vmassol> smartGWT too  
14:07 <vmassol> ok so the guy asked us to create the language but he didn't contribute anyting yet  
14:09 <vmassol> msmeria1: done, you're now super admin on the xiwki.org farm, be careful :)  
14:10 <msmeria1> vmassol: thanks. I'll be careful :)  
14:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <NuxRo> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <NuxRo> Hello, I'm trying to link a running Libreoffice installation into Xwiki, but searching for the "OpenOffice server" page proves quite tricky. Where do I find this page?  
14:48 <NuxRo> This is a fresh Xwiki install and I'm logged in as Admin  
14:53 <NuxRo> aha, found it  
14:53 <tmortagne> NuxRo: on the top menu you should have a "Home" button next to Add, put your mouse over it and click "Administer Wiki"  
14:53 <tmortagne> too late :)  
14:59 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:07 <NuxRo> tmortagne: it's okay, you can help me with this .. :-)  
15:08 <NuxRo> I've set XWIKI\_OPTS="$XWIKI\_OPTS -Dxwiki.data.dir=$XWIKI\_DATA\_DIR -Dorg.eclipse.jetty.server.Request.maxFormContentSize=10000000"  
15:08 <NuxRo> but it still crashes with java.lang.IllegalStateException: Form too large 1914305>1000000  
15:08 <NuxRo> it looks like it's ignoring my setting  
15:09 <NuxRo> that's in start\_wiki.sh  
15:09 <tmortagne> so you are using the hsqldb/jetty distribution ?  
15:10 <NuxRo> tmortagne: yes, this is just to show a PoC  
15:11 <tmortagne> I don't really know this error, first time I see this  
15:12 <tmortagne> now for start\_wiki.sh, I don't see why it would not take that into account  
15:12 <vmassol> it's a typical one  
15:12 <vmassol> I know about it  
15:12 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/FormTooLargeError  
15:12 <vmassol> you can google for "xwiki form too large" and you'll get plenty results  
15:24 <Lyes2> has quit  
15:25 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <ClemensR> NuxRo: look at line 96 of start\_xwiki.sh, your setting is overwritten there ;)  
15:35 <Lyes1> has quit  
15:52 <NuxRo> ClemensR: indeed  
15:52 <NuxRo> thanks :)  
15:52 <ClemensR> :)  
15:52 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
15:53 <Lyes1> has quit  
15:53 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <Denis> has quit  
16:04 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
16:21 <vmassol> FYI I've just added http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HWhyjoinXWikiContrib  
16:21 <vmassol> if anyone disagrees let me know  
16:21 <vmassol> (and I'll bring it to the list as a vote/proposla)  
16:22 <vmassol> handling the localization projectcreation now  
16:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: https://github.com/vrachieru/xwiki-localization-sort should probably be moved if possible instead or creating a new one  
16:24 <vmassol> indeed  
16:24 <vmassol> I'll ask  
16:24 <tmortagne> I think Victor as to transfer the ownership himself from the project settings  
16:25 <tmortagne> s/as/has/  
16:25 <vmassol> yes  
16:26 <vmassol> now thinking about the naming  
16:26 <vmassol> it's the frist time we have just a script service I think  
16:26 <vmassol> maybe we should consider it an api  
16:26 <vmassol> api-localization-sort  
16:26 <vmassol> ?  
16:26 <vmassol> to follow the application-xxx and macro-xxx namings  
16:26 <vmassol> ?  
16:30 <evalica> has quit  
16:30 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:30 <tmortagne> ok for api  
16:30 <tmortagne> or nothing  
16:31 <vmassol> I prefer api to be symmetrical with applications- and macros-  
16:31 <vmassol> now if we have a full fledged app with a api....  
16:32 <vmassol> ah  
16:33 <vmassol> then I'd propose application- since the main goal in this case is still the application  
16:33 <tmortagne> but it's not an application  
16:33 <vmassol> (with 2 submodules)  
16:33 <tmortagne> it's more a library  
16:33 <vmassol> talking generally  
16:33 <vmassol> in this case it's an api  
16:34 <vmassol> so there's no problem  
16:38 <vmassol> I agree that the only real general solution that would work for all cases perfectly well is not to have any prefix…. but you need good naming in this case. For ex you cannot just say "chart" whereas macro-chart has some meaning already (even if not good enough to differentiate from the existing chart macro). hmmm naming is always the hardest :)

20:53 <EA> has joined #xwiki  
20:56 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
20:58 <EA> question: I’m helping with a migration from a single wiki format to a multi-wiki tenancy. using MySQL and Tomcat. is the best course to preserve version history and comments as well as hierarchy/structure of a space’s child pages to simply use the built-in export XAR feature and edit the program.xml files for each new wiki’s subset of content?  
20:58 <EA> we are on XWiki v6.0.1
